data.meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.
data.sentence: The word رَبِّكَ comes from the root ر ب ب and is associated with the meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.

data.meanings: to swim, roll onwards, perform a daily course, float, the act of swimming, occupy oneself in: the accomplishment of his needful affairs or seeking the means of subsistence, business/occupation, those who are floating, went/travel far, being quick/swift. To praise/glorify/hollow/magnify, sing/celebrate praise, holy, declaring God to be far removed or free for every imperfection/impurity
data.sentence: The word وَسَبِّحْ comes from the root س ب ح and is associated with the meanings: to swim, roll onwards, perform a daily course, float, the act of swimming, occupy oneself in: the accomplishment of his needful affairs or seeking the means of subsistence, business/occupation, those who are floating, went/travel far, being quick/swift. To praise/glorify/hollow/magnify, sing/celebrate praise, holy, declaring God to be far removed or free for every imperfection/impurity

data.meanings: (Ha-Alif-Nun) To arrive, come, be at hand (time, season), be fit, be reaped.
data.sentence: The word حِينَ comes from the root ح ي ن and is associated with the meanings: (Ha-Alif-Nun) To arrive, come, be at hand (time, season), be fit, be reaped.

data.meanings: to bind, be patient or constant, endure patiently, steadily adhere to reason and command, restrain from what reason and law forbid, restrain from manifesting grief, agitation and impatience. The word being the contrary of jaz'a (manifestation of grief and agitation).. . Sabar (prf. 3rd. p.m. sing.): He bore with patience.. Sabaruu (prf. 3rd. p.m. plu.): They bore patiently, patiently preserved.. Sabartum (prf. 2nd. p.m. plu.): You patiently preserved.. Sabarnaa (imp. 1st. p.m. plu.): We patiently preserved.. Yasbir (imp. 3rd. p.m. sing. fuss.): He patiently preserves.. Tasbiru (imp. 2nd. p.m. sing. fuss.): You have patience.. Tasbiruuna/Tasbiruu (acc. /imp. 2nd. p.m. plu. juss.): You will patiently preserve.. . Nasbira imp. neg. 1st. p. plu. ): We will not at all remain content.. Nasbiranna (imp. 1st. p. plu.): We will surely endure patiently.. Isbir (prt. m. sing.): Preserve thou (in doing good); Bear patiently; Wait thou patiently.. Isbiruu (prt. in. plu.): Be patiently preserving.. Saabiruu (prt. m. plu. III): Strive to excel in being patiently preserving.. Istabir (prt. in. plu. sing.): Be steadfast.. Sabrun/Sabran (acc./ v. n.): Patience.. Saabiruun/ Saabiriin (acc. /act. pic. plu.): Those who are calm and steadfast.. Saabiratun (act. plc. f sing.): Preserving one f.. Saabiraat (act. plc. f. plu.): Preserving women.. Asbara (elative.) : How very enduring.. Sabaar (ints. sing.): Patiently preserving.. Saabiran (act. pic. m. sing. acc.): Patient.
data.sentence: The word وَاصْبِرْ comes from the root ص ب ر and is associated with the meanings: to bind, be patient or constant, endure patiently, steadily adhere to reason and command, restrain from what reason and law forbid, restrain from manifesting grief, agitation and impatience. The word being the contrary of jaz'a (manifestation of grief and agitation).. . Sabar (prf. 3rd. p.m. sing.): He bore with patience.. Sabaruu (prf. 3rd. p.m. plu.): They bore patiently, patiently preserved.. Sabartum (prf. 2nd. p.m. plu.): You patiently preserved.. Sabarnaa (imp. 1st. p.m. plu.): We patiently preserved.. Yasbir (imp. 3rd. p.m. sing. fuss.): He patiently preserves.. Tasbiru (imp. 2nd. p.m. sing. fuss.): You have patience.. Tasbiruuna/Tasbiruu (acc. /imp. 2nd. p.m. plu. juss.): You will patiently preserve.. . Nasbira imp. neg. 1st. p. plu. ): We will not at all remain content.. Nasbiranna (imp. 1st. p. plu.): We will surely endure patiently.. Isbir (prt. m. sing.): Preserve thou (in doing good); Bear patiently; Wait thou patiently.. Isbiruu (prt. in. plu.): Be patiently preserving.. Saabiruu (prt. m. plu. III): Strive to excel in being patiently preserving.. Istabir (prt. in. plu. sing.): Be steadfast.. Sabrun/Sabran (acc./ v. n.): Patience.. Saabiruun/ Saabiriin (acc. /act. pic. plu.): Those who are calm and steadfast.. Saabiratun (act. plc. f sing.): Preserving one f.. Saabiraat (act. plc. f. plu.): Preserving women.. Asbara (elative.) : How very enduring.. Sabaar (ints. sing.): Patiently preserving.. Saabiran (act. pic. m. sing. acc.): Patient.

data.meanings: to hurt in the eye, smite anyone with the evil eye, flow tears, become a spy. Aayan - to view, face. 'Ainun - eye, look, hole, but of a tree, spy, middle letter of a trilateral word, spring of water, chief, personage of a place. A'yan (pl. 'Inun): lovely, wide-eyed, lovely black eyed. Ma'iinun - water, spring.
data.sentence: The word بِأَعْيُنِنَا comes from the root ع ي ن and is associated with the meanings: to hurt in the eye, smite anyone with the evil eye, flow tears, become a spy. Aayan - to view, face. 'Ainun - eye, look, hole, but of a tree, spy, middle letter of a trilateral word, spring of water, chief, personage of a place. A'yan (pl. 'Inun): lovely, wide-eyed, lovely black eyed. Ma'iinun - water, spring.
The word بِحَمْدِ comes from the root ح م د and is associated with the meanings: To praise.

data.meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.
data.sentence: The word تَقُومُ comes from the root ق و م and is associated with the meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.

data.meanings: To restrain from, exercise authority, command, give judgment, judge, be wise.
data.sentence: The word لِحُكْمِ comes from the root ح ك م and is associated with the meanings: To restrain from, exercise authority, command, give judgment, judge, be wise.
